page.title: 01PENCOED-A general view
page.content: {Pencoed}is a small town situated close to Bridgend which is twenty miles west of Cardiff. It mainly consists of houses and shops although there are also small hills and agricultural areas. Pencoed has the usual small town facilities, such as parks, swimming pools, banks, petrol filling stations, dentists and doctor's surgeries. There is a railway track running through the centre of town which often causes a build up of traffic when the crossing gates are closed. There are two primary schools and one comprehensive school in the locality. The area also includes the villages of{Brynna}and{Llanharan. Llanharan is dominated by a huge open-cast colliery, although the village contains shops, houses and a primary school which caters for children who speak Welsh and English.
